alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Hickman; Humphreys; Rutherford; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:01PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Davidson, southern Dickson, Rutherford, Williamson, south central Cheatham, northern Humphreys and northeastern Hickman Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 401 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Waverly to 6 miles south of Nolensville. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Franklin, Dickson, Waverly, Camden, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Spring Hill, Nolensville, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, White Bluff, Belle Meade, Kingston Springs, Thompson`s Station, Pegram, McEwen, Burns and Fairview. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 160 and 197. Interstate 65 between mile markers 56 and 75. Interstate 24 between mile markers 61 and 87. Interstate 840 between mile markers 1 and 18, and between mile markers 22 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Hickman; Humphreys; Rutherford; Williamson
